intro: Dichorisandra gaudichaudiana var. induta, commonly known as the velvetleaf pomegranate, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and produces clusters of small, fleshy, red berries. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
